intro: Astragalus mokiacensis, commonly known as the Mokiacensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Astragalus mokiacensis is often found in steppe and desert ecosystems, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
